name: CanvasWizard AI
description: An agentic LLM that instantly builds a complete Business Model Canvas by researching market size, revenue streams, cost structures, competitors and then formatting the results into a ready‑to‑use canvas document (PDF/Markdown). Users simply describe their product idea and target market, and CanvasWizard does the heavy lifting in minutes.

tools.name: web_search
tools.description: Performs a live web search for the given query and returns the top three result snippets formatted in Markdown.

query.description: The search query to send to the search engine.

tools.name: fetch_market_report
tools.description: Retrieves a structured market‑research report for a specified industry and year from a paid data‑provider API and returns key metrics (market size, growth rate, average CAC, LTV, etc.) as JSON.

year.description: Fiscal year for the report (default is the current year).

tools.name: get_company_financials
tools.description: Pulls publicly available financial metrics (ARR, churn, CAC, gross margin, etc.) for a given public or disclosed private company from financial‑data APIs.

company_name.description: Exact name of the company to look up.

tools.name: get_competitor_analysis
tools.description: Returns a concise competitor landscape for a given industry, including top N competitors, their primary value propositions, pricing models, and estimated market shares.

top_n.description: How many top competitors to return (default 5).

tools.name: summarize_text
tools.description: Accepts a long text (or HTML) and returns a concise summary limited to the specified number of sentences.

text.description: The raw text to be summarized.

max_sentences.description: Maximum number of sentences in the summary.

tools.name: generate_canvas
tools.description: Creates a markdown representation of a Business Model Canvas from a structured data object containing the nine canvas blocks.

canvas_data.description: Object with keys: value_proposition, customer_segments, channels, customer_relationships, revenue_streams, key_resources, key_activities, key_partners, cost_structure. Each key holds a list of strings.

tools.name: export_to_pdf
tools.description: Converts a markdown Business Model Canvas into a PDF file and returns a temporary download URL.

canvas_markdown.description: The full markdown of the canvas.

filename.description: Desired filename for the PDF (without extension).

examples.description: User asks for a canvas for a subscription coffee delivery startup. The assistant pulls market size, industry metrics, summarises them and returns a complete canvas ready for export.

messages.content: You are CanvasWizard, an expert AI that builds Business Model Canvases. Use the provided tools to gather data, summarise insights and finally produce a markdown canvas. Offer a PDF export if the user wants it.
Create a Business Model Canvas for a subscription‑based coffee delivery service targeting millennials in the United States.
I will first fetch recent market data for the coffee‑subscription space.

## Search results
- The coffee subscription market in the US was valued at **$1.2 B** in 2023, with an expected CAGR of **8 %** through 2028. (Source: Statista)
- 42 % of millennials say they would consider a monthly coffee delivery service. (Source: Nielsen)
- Top players include Trade Coffee, Bean Box, and Blue Bottle Subscriptions.
Got the data. I will now craft the canvas blocks.

value_proposition: Personalized blend recommendations via a short quiz
customer_segments: Urban millennials (aged 25‑38) who value convenience and quality
Remote workers seeking a home office perk
revenue_streams: Affiliate commissions from coffee machine partners
cost_structure: Cost of goods sold (coffee beans, packaging)

messages.content:
# Business Model Canvas – Coffee Subscription Startup

**Value Proposition**
- Curated, high‑quality coffee delivered monthly
- Sustainable packaging and carbon‑neutral shipping
- Personalized blend recommendations via a short quiz

**Customer Segments**
- Urban millennials (25‑38) who value convenience & quality
- Remote workers seeking a home‑office perk

**Channels**
- Mobile app & website
- Social media ads (Instagram, TikTok)
- Partnerships with co‑working spaces

**Customer Relationships**
- Subscription‑based with easy pause/resume
- Monthly coffee‑tasting newsletters
- Community forum for coffee lovers

**Revenue Streams**
- Monthly subscription fees ($15‑$30)
- Premium add‑ons (single‑origin beans, accessories)
- Affiliate commissions from coffee‑machine partners

**Key Resources**
- Supply contracts with specialty roasters
- Logistics & fulfillment network
- Data‑driven recommendation engine

**Key Activities**
- Sourcing & roasting coordination
- Packaging & shipping
- Customer acquisition & retention marketing

**Key Partners**
- Specialty roasters
- Eco‑friendly packaging suppliers
- Last‑mile delivery providers

**Cost Structure**
- COGS (beans, packaging)
- Shipping & fulfillment
- Marketing & acquisition (CAC ≈ $30)
- Technology stack (app, AI)
Here is the complete Business Model Canvas in markdown. Would you like me to export it as a PDF?

examples.description: User already has a SaaS canvas and wants alternative revenue streams and refined cost estimates. The assistant pulls comparable SaaS financials and competitor analysis, then updates the canvas.

messages.content: You are CanvasWizard, an AI specialist that can enrich, modify and re‑export Business Model Canvases using live data.
I have a canvas for my project‑management SaaS aimed at small teams. I want to explore other revenue streams and get a better sense of typical costs. Can you help?
Sure! I will fetch financial benchmarks from a similar public SaaS and get a competitor landscape.
Based on the benchmarks, here are a few alternative revenue ideas and a refined cost outlook. I will now regenerate the canvas with these updates.

value_proposition: All‑in‑one project‑management platform for small teams
customer_segments: Remote teams looking for lightweight PM

messages.content:
# Updated Business Model Canvas – Project‑Management SaaS

**Value Proposition**
- All‑in‑one project‑management platform for small teams
- Real‑time collaboration & workflow automation

**Customer Segments**
- Small businesses (5‑20 employees)
- Remote teams looking for lightweight PM

**Channels**
- Free‑to‑use web app
- Content marketing & webinars
- Partner integrations (Slack, Google Workspace)

**Customer Relationships**
- Self‑service onboarding
- Community forums & knowledge base
- Premium support for paid tiers

**Revenue Streams**
- Tiered subscription (Basic $8/user, Pro $15/user, Enterprise custom)
- Add‑on modules (Advanced reporting, API access)
- Marketplace of third‑party integrations (revenue share)
- Professional services (implementation, training)

**Key Resources**
- Engineering team building core platform
- Cloud infrastructure (AWS)
- Customer success & support staff

**Key Activities**
- Product development & continuous delivery
- Customer acquisition (SEO, webinars)
- Support & community management

**Key Partners**
- Cloud service provider (AWS)
- Integration partners (Slack, Zapier)
- Channel partners (resellers)

**Cost Structure**
- Cloud hosting (≈ 25 % of ARR)
- Engineering salaries
- Sales & marketing (CAC ≈ $250, churn ≈ 5 %)
- Customer support & success
- R&D for new add‑on modules
Here’s the revised canvas with alternative revenue streams and a more detailed cost structure. Let me know if you’d like a PDF export or any further tweaks.
